review.title: A Mixed Graphical Model for Rhythmic Parsing
review.abstract: a method is presented for the rhythmic analog parsing problem : given a sequence distribution of previously observed predicted musical note level onset times, where we estimate the corresponding frequently notated rhythm sequence and tempo process. a graphical model is developed that represents : the simultaneous evolution parameter of tempo rhythm and rhythm and relates locally these formerly hidden theoretical quantities to observations. and the rhythm expectation variables variables are considered discrete and the tempo and momentum observation variables given are similarly continuous. we show we how to fully compute the globally most likely configuration of generating the tempo and rhythm variables obtained given an observation of those note onset times. two preliminary mathematical experiments eventually are presented on a progressively small data set. from a generalization paradigm to arbitrary defined conditional angular gaussian distributions is outlined.
histories: Appears in Proceedings of the Seventeenth Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence (UAI2001)
